pullRequest.body:
The script contained in this file tries to automatically generate deprecations for declarations that were renamed in a PR.

The script is entirely text-based, so it makes several simplifying assumptions and may be easily confused.

#### Assumptions

The script works under the assumption that the only modifications between `master` and the current branch are renames of lemmas that should be deprecated.

The script inspects the relevant `git diff`, extracts the old name and the new one and uses this information to insert deprecated aliases as needed.

Most other differences may confuse the script, although there is some slack.

Please, do not try to push the boundaries of the script, since it is quite simple-minded!

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3408cee2c8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18150/commits/3408cee2c81ce2ebd762dffe3671a2608b1a999e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ DefRemoved`
`+ LemRemoved`
`+ ThmRemoved`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This worked well for me with #18191 (macOS)

I'm glad to hear that the script works, also on macOS.  It is fairly simple-minded, but if it gets used more extensively, I can look into making it more robust.  The declarations_diff script started in a similar way and seems to perform quite well.

@mattrobball I see that there is a [deprecations commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18191/commits/e802e12cbd94ddf5ddf3965c50f8e9020c7c9d09) in your PR: was that autogenerated?  Did you have to do any post-editing to it?

> @mattrobball I see that there is a [deprecations commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18191/commits/e802e12cbd94ddf5ddf3965c50f8e9020c7c9d09) in your PR: was that autogenerated? Did you have to do any post-editing to it?

Yes and no
Great, that's awesome as it also tested the automatic line-breaking part that is new.

When I tried out this script on #18288, it missed the lemmas `ι_preservesColimitsIso_hom` and `ι_preservesColimitsIso_inv`, presumably because the names start with a greek letter. Not sure whether fixing this would fall under "do not try to push the boundaries of the script".

Ah, yes, the heuristic that the script uses for a "declaration name" is "starts with an upper/lowercase letter or `_`".

If the actual regex of starts of identifiers is available, it should be easy enough to use that instead and I think that it would be perfectly in scope for the script!

> If the actual regex of starts of identifiers is available

The relevant code is [here](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/f54bce2abbbd7a379b0a1ad505d178384baad37d/src/Init/Meta.lean#L77-L101). So I guess a regex for the first letter of an identifier could be

```
[a-zA-Z_\u3b1-\u3ba\u3bc-\u3c9\u391-\u39f\u3a1-\u3a2\u3a4-\u3a9\u3ca-\u3fb\u1f00-\u1ffe\u2100-\u214f\u1d49c-\u1d59f]
```

Awesome, thank you very much!  I added your regex to the script.

If it turns out that there are other issues with this, I may switch to a "negative" regex: simply excluding some characters that certainly do not begin an identifier (e.g. parentheses, digits, punctuation marks...) and maybe generate deprecations for commands that were not creating a declaration.

There are still some issues with the script: I tried using it in #18330 and here is the result: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18330/commits/d455e51043e3831db5e58499661068e5bbfb1161. You see that it is for example adding `@[deprecated (since := "2024-10-28")] alias  := isInducing` in `Topology.DenseEmbedding`

Yaël, thank you, this is very useful!  I will try to debug this, but note that I did not hard-code non-printing of "nameless" deprecations, so I consider the whole run in your file a great success!  :smile:
Ah, the lemma that the script is using is *new*!  There is no deprecation to be made, right?
I pushed a new version of the script that should skip printing a deprecation for a declaration that is "just new".

There are still some issues with the script duplicating aliases: See Topology.Maps.Basic [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18398/commits/07b1b6356ddd436192ff678bed8291fca97df5b6). The pattern is that I rename a declaration from `A` to `B`, then change declaration `C` (but do not rename it). The script results in
```
lemma B := ...

@[deprecated] alias A := B

lemma C := ...

@[deprecated] alias A := C
```
It's as if the script "forgot" it already added a deprecation for `A`

pullRequest.title: feat: add deprecation script
